description: recto: sketchy study of head and upper body of woman with her hair up, wearing a crown, with heavy draperies on her shoulders; from PL side; verso: study of the head, torso and outstretched PL arm of a draped woman with her hair in a bun, from PL side
medium: Black and white chalk on blue paper
provenance: [Stanhope Shelton, Suffolk, until 1977; sold August 3, for Â£32, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1977-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Study of a Crowned Woman Kneeling
